required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 52-104 Week Off-therapy Second Extension to Study CSPP100A2365
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-blind 52 to 104 Week Off-therapy Extension Study to Evaluate the Long Term Growth and Development of Pediatric Hypertensive Patients 6 - 17 Years of Age Previously Treated With Aliskiren in Studies CSPP100A2365 and/or CSPP100A2365E1

brief_summary.textblock: 52-104 week off-therapy second extension to study CSPP100A2365 to assess growth and development in pediatric hypertensive patients previously treated with aliskiren in studies SPP100A2365 and SPP100A2365E1

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Weight Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to Long Term (LT) Visit 18 (Week 104) for the Enrolled to Follow-up Set (EFS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to LT Visit 18 (Week 104): 2 years (104 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Participant weight was measured at Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core study), LT Visit 17, LT Visit 18 ([Week 104] only for participants identified in the core study as having primary hypertension), and LT Visit 19 ([Week 156] only for participants identified in the core study as having secondary hypertension). Body weight was measured to the nearest 0.1 kg in indoor clothing, but without shoes.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Height Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to Long Term (LT) Visit 18 (Week 104) for the EFS
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to LT Visit 18 (Week 104): 2 years (104 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Participant height was measured at Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core study), LT Visit 17, LT Visit 18 ([Week 104] only for participants identified in the core study as having primary hypertension), and LT Visit 19 ([Week 156] only for participants identified in the core study as having secondary hypertension).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in BMI Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to Long Term (LT) Visit 18 (Week 104) for the EFS
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to LT Visit 18 (Week 104): 2 years (104 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Participant height and weight was measured at Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core study), LT Visit 17, LT Visit 18 ([Week 104] only for participants identified in the core study as having primary hypertension), and LT Visit 19 ([Week 156] only for participants identified in the core study as having secondary hypertension). BMI was derived.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Neurocognitive Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to Long Term (LT) Visit 18 (Week 104) for the EFS
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to LT Visit 18 (Week 104): 2 years (104 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: All participants who were determined to have secondary hypertension in the core study and had a Baseline (Visit 2) standardized neurocognitive assessment in the core study received follow-up neurocognitive assessments at LT Visit 18 and LT Visit 19 with the same tool. The neurocognitive assessment of development included assessment of the following abilities: Attention, Processing speed, Working memory, and Motor speed. For Numbers (Forward and Backward Raw Score), Visual Matching (Number Correct), Sequences (Total Raw Score): positive change indicates a numerical increase, which is considered a better outcome/improvement; negative change/numerical decrease is considered a worse outcome/decline. For Visual Matching (Time to Complete), Time Tapping (Right and Left Hands), and Timed Gait: positive change indicates a numerical increase, which is considered a worse outcome/decline; negative change/numerical decrease is considered a better outcome/improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Weight Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to End of Study (EOS) by Hypertension Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to EOS (2 to 3 years). EOS was defined as LT Visit 18 (Week 104) and LT Visit 19 (Week 156) for participants with primary and secondary hypertension, respectively.
secondary_outcome.description: Participant weight was measured at Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core study), LT Visit 17, LT Visit 18 ([Week 104] only for participants identified in the core study as having primary hypertension), and LT Visit 19 ([Week 156] only for participants identified in the core study as having secondary hypertension). Body weight was measured to the nearest 0.1 kg in indoor clothing, but without shoes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Height Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to EOS by Hypertension Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to EOS (2 to 3 years). EOS was defined as LT Visit 18 (Week 104) and LT Visit 19 (Week 156) for participants with primary and secondary hypertension, respectively.
secondary_outcome.description: Participant height was measured at Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core study), LT Visit 17, LT Visit 18 ([Week 104] only for participants identified in the core study as having primary hypertension), and LT Visit 19 ([Week 156] only for participants identified in the core study as having secondary hypertension).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in BMI Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to EOS by Hypertension Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to EOS (2 to 3 years). EOS was defined as LT Visit 18 (Week 104) and LT Visit 19 (Week 156) for participants with primary and secondary hypertension, respectively.
secondary_outcome.description: Participant weight and height was measured at Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core study), LT Visit 17, LT Visit 18 ([Week 104] only for participants identified in the core study as having primary hypertension), and LT Visit 19 ([Week 156] only for participants identified in the core study as having secondary hypertension). Body weight was measured to the nearest 0.1 kg in indoor clothing, but without shoes. BMI was derived.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Neurocognitive Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to EOS by Hypertension Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to EOS (3 years). EOS was defined as LT Visit 19 (Week 156) for participants with secondary hypertension.
secondary_outcome.description: All participants who were determined to have secondary hypertension in the core study and had a Baseline (Visit 2) standardized neurocognitive assessment in the core study received follow-up neurocognitive assessments at LT Visit 18 and LT Visit 19 with the same tool. The neurocognitive assessment of development included assessment of the following abilities: Attention, Processing speed, Working memory, and Motor speed. For Numbers (Forward and Backward Raw Score), Visual Matching (Number Correct), Sequences (Total Raw Score): positive change indicates a numerical increase, which is considered a better outcome/improvement; negative change/numerical decrease is considered a worse outcome/decline. For Visual Matching (Time to Complete), Time Tapping (Right and Left Hands), and Timed Gait: positive change indicates a numerical increase, which is considered a worse outcome/decline; negative change/numerical decrease is considered a better outcome/improvement.

arm_group.description: All patients previously treated with study medication in the CSPP100A2365 and CSPP100A2365E1 studies.

study_pop.textblock: pediatric hypertensive patients 6 - 17 years of age previously treated with aliskiren in studies CSPP100A2365 and/or CSPP100A2365E1

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Successful completion of study CSPP100A2365E1
- Patients must meet inclusion criteria set forth for trials CSPP100A2365 and CSPP100A2365E1
- Informed consent/ patient assent
Exclusion Criteria:
•Patients who did not successfully complete studies CSPP100A2365 and CSPP100A2365E1

group.title: Enalapril
group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. The arm/group in this second extension study refers to the actual treatment arm/group assigned at the end of the first extension study (Study CSPP100A2365E1: ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT01151410). During Study CSPP100A2365E1, participants were to receive one of the following doses of enalapril based on their weight: low weight (≥20 to <50 kg) participants - starting dose 2.5 mg with optional titration to 5 and then 10 mg; mid weight (≥50 to <80 kg) participants - starting dose 5 mg with optional titration to 10 and then 20 mg; high weight (≥80 to ≤150 kg) participants - starting dose 10 mg with optional titration to 20 and then 40 mg.

group.title: Aliskiren
group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. The arm/group in this second extension study refers to the actual treatment arm/group assigned at the end of the first extension study (Study CSPP100A2365E1: ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT01151410). During Study CSPP100A2365E1, participants were to receive one of the following doses of aliskiren based on their weight: low weight (≥20 to <50 kg) participants - starting dose 37.5 mg with optional titration to 75 and then 150 mg; mid weight (≥50 to <80 kg) participants - starting dose 75 mg with optional titration to 150 and then 300 mg; high weight (≥80 to ≤150 kg) participants - starting dose 150 mg with optional titration to 300 and then 600 mg.

group.title: Enalapril
group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. The arm/group in this second extension study refers to the actual treatment arm/group assigned at the end of the first extension study (Study CSPP100A2365E1: ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT01151410). During Study CSPP100A2365E1, participants were to receive one of the following doses of enalapril based on their weight: low weight (≥20 to <50 kg) participants - starting dose 2.5 mg with optional titration to 5 and then 10 mg; mid weight (≥50 to <80 kg) participants - starting dose 5 mg with optional titration to 10 and then 20 mg; high weight (≥80 to ≤150 kg) participants - starting dose 10 mg with optional titration to 20 and then 40 mg.

group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change in Weight Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to Long Term (LT) Visit 18 (Week 104) for the Enrolled to Follow-up Set (EFS)
outcome.description: Participant weight was measured at Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core study), LT Visit 17, LT Visit 18 ([Week 104] only for participants identified in the core study as having primary hypertension), and LT Visit 19 ([Week 156] only for participants identified in the core study as having secondary hypertension). Body weight was measured to the nearest 0.1 kg in indoor clothing, but without shoes.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to LT Visit 18 (Week 104): 2 years (104 weeks)
outcome.population: The EFS consisted of all participants who signed the informed consent form (ICF) for the second extension study. Number of participants is the number of EFS participants with non-missing measurement at LT Visit 18. Participants with missing data at LT Visit 18 were not included in the analysis.

group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. analysis.p_value_desc: p-value for statistical significance at 0.05 level for 2-sided superiority testing.
analysis.method_desc: Treatment regimen, region, age strata, and hypertension etiology (primary, secondary) as factors, and Baseline weight as covariates.

analysis.method_desc: Treatment regimen, region, age strata, and hypertension etiology (primary, secondary) as factors, and Baseline BMI as covariates.

outcome.title: Change in Neurocognitive Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to Long Term (LT) Visit 18 (Week 104) for the EFS
outcome.description: All participants who were determined to have secondary hypertension in the core study and had a Baseline (Visit 2) standardized neurocognitive assessment in the core study received follow-up neurocognitive assessments at LT Visit 18 and LT Visit 19 with the same tool. The neurocognitive assessment of development included assessment of the following abilities: Attention, Processing speed, Working memory, and Motor speed. For Numbers (Forward and Backward Raw Score), Visual Matching (Number Correct), Sequences (Total Raw Score): positive change indicates a numerical increase, which is considered a better outcome/improvement; negative change/numerical decrease is considered a worse outcome/decline. For Visual Matching (Time to Complete), Time Tapping (Right and Left Hands), and Timed Gait: positive change indicates a numerical increase, which is considered a worse outcome/decline; negative change/numerical decrease is considered a better outcome/improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to LT Visit 18 (Week 104): 2 years (104 weeks)
outcome.population: The EFS consisted of all participants who signed the ICF for the second extension study. Number of participants is those with secondary hypertension and both baseline and LT Visit 18 observations for that test.

group.title: Enalapril
group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. Number of participants is the number of EFS participants with non-missing measurement at EOS. EOS was defined as LT Visit 18 (Week 104) and LT Visit 19 (Week 156) for participants with primary and secondary hypertension, respectively.

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value for statistical significance at 0.05 level for 2-sided superiority testing.
analysis.method_desc: Treatment regimen, region, age strata, and Baseline height as covariates

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value for statistical significance at 0.05 level for 2-sided superiority testing.
analysis.method_desc: Treatment regimen, region, age strata, and Baseline height as covariates.

outcome.title: Change in BMI Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to EOS by Hypertension Group
outcome.description: Participant weight and height was measured at Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core study), LT Visit 17, LT Visit 18 ([Week 104] only for participants identified in the core study as having primary hypertension), and LT Visit 19 ([Week 156] only for participants identified in the core study as having secondary hypertension). Body weight was measured to the nearest 0.1 kg in indoor clothing, but without shoes. BMI was derived.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to EOS (2 to 3 years). EOS was defined as LT Visit 18 (Week 104) and LT Visit 19 (Week 156) for participants with primary and secondary hypertension, respectively.
outcome.population: The EFS consisted of all participants who signed the ICF for the second extension study. Number of participants is the number of EFS participants with non-missing measurement at EOS. EOS was defined as LT Visit 18 (Week 104) and LT Visit 19 (Week 156) for participants with primary and secondary hypertension, respectively.

group.title: Enalapril
group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. The arm/group in this second extension study refers to the actual treatment arm/group assigned at the end of the first extension study (Study CSPP100A2365E1: ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT01151410). During Study CSPP100A2365E1, participants were to receive one of the following doses of enalapril based on their weight: low weight (≥20 to <50 kg) participants - starting dose 2.5 mg with optional titration to 5 and then 10 mg; mid weight (≥50 to <80 kg) participants - starting dose 5 mg with optional titration to 10 and then 20 mg; high weight (≥80 to ≤150 kg) participants - starting dose 10 mg with optional titration to 20 and then 40 mg.

group.title: Aliskiren
group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. The arm/group in this second extension study refers to the actual treatment arm/group assigned at the end of the first extension study (Study CSPP100A2365E1: ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT01151410). During Study CSPP100A2365E1, participants were to receive one of the following doses of aliskiren based on their weight: low weight (≥20 to <50 kg) participants - starting dose 37.5 mg with optional titration to 75 and then 150 mg; mid weight (≥50 to <80 kg) participants - starting dose 75 mg with optional titration to 150 and then 300 mg; high weight (≥80 to ≤150 kg) participants - starting dose 150 mg with optional titration to 300 and then 600 mg.

measure.title: Change in BMI Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to EOS by Hypertension Group
measure.description: Participant weight and height was measured at Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core study), LT Visit 17, LT Visit 18 ([Week 104] only for participants identified in the core study as having primary hypertension), and LT Visit 19 ([Week 156] only for participants identified in the core study as having secondary hypertension). Body weight was measured to the nearest 0.1 kg in indoor clothing, but without shoes. BMI was derived.
measure.population: The EFS consisted of all participants who signed the ICF for the second extension study. Number of participants is the number of EFS participants with non-missing measurement at EOS. EOS was defined as LT Visit 18 (Week 104) and LT Visit 19 (Week 156) for participants with primary and secondary hypertension, respectively.

outcome.title: Change in Neurocognitive Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to EOS by Hypertension Group
outcome.description: All participants who were determined to have secondary hypertension in the core study and had a Baseline (Visit 2) standardized neurocognitive assessment in the core study received follow-up neurocognitive assessments at LT Visit 18 and LT Visit 19 with the same tool. The neurocognitive assessment of development included assessment of the following abilities: Attention, Processing speed, Working memory, and Motor speed. For Numbers (Forward and Backward Raw Score), Visual Matching (Number Correct), Sequences (Total Raw Score): positive change indicates a numerical increase, which is considered a better outcome/improvement; negative change/numerical decrease is considered a worse outcome/decline. For Visual Matching (Time to Complete), Time Tapping (Right and Left Hands), and Timed Gait: positive change indicates a numerical increase, which is considered a worse outcome/decline; negative change/numerical decrease is considered a better outcome/improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to EOS (3 years). EOS was defined as LT Visit 19 (Week 156) for participants with secondary hypertension.
outcome.population: The EFS consisted of all participants who signed the ICF for the second extension study. Number of participants is those with secondary hypertension and both baseline and LT Visit 19 observations for that test.

group.title: Enalapril
group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. The arm/group in this second extension study refers to the actual treatment arm/group assigned at the end of the first extension study (Study CSPP100A2365E1: ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT01151410). During Study CSPP100A2365E1, participants were to receive one of the following doses of enalapril based on their weight: low weight (≥20 to <50 kg) participants - starting dose 2.5 mg with optional titration to 5 and then 10 mg; mid weight (≥50 to <80 kg) participants - starting dose 5 mg with optional titration to 10 and then 20 mg; high weight (≥80 to ≤150 kg) participants - starting dose 10 mg with optional titration to 20 and then 40 mg.

group.title: Aliskiren
group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. The arm/group in this second extension study refers to the actual treatment arm/group assigned at the end of the first extension study (Study CSPP100A2365E1: ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT01151410). During Study CSPP100A2365E1, participants were to receive one of the following doses of aliskiren based on their weight: low weight (≥20 to <50 kg) participants - starting dose 37.5 mg with optional titration to 75 and then 150 mg; mid weight (≥50 to <80 kg) participants - starting dose 75 mg with optional titration to 150 and then 300 mg; high weight (≥80 to ≤150 kg) participants - starting dose 150 mg with optional titration to 300 and then 600 mg.

measure.title: Change in Neurocognitive Assessments From Baseline (Visit 2 of the Core Study) to EOS by Hypertension Group
measure.description: All participants who were determined to have secondary hypertension in the core study and had a Baseline (Visit 2) standardized neurocognitive assessment in the core study received follow-up neurocognitive assessments at LT Visit 18 and LT Visit 19 with the same tool. The neurocognitive assessment of development included assessment of the following abilities: Attention, Processing speed, Working memory, and Motor speed. For Numbers (Forward and Backward Raw Score), Visual Matching (Number Correct), Sequences (Total Raw Score): positive change indicates a numerical increase, which is considered a better outcome/improvement; negative change/numerical decrease is considered a worse outcome/decline. For Visual Matching (Time to Complete), Time Tapping (Right and Left Hands), and Timed Gait: positive change indicates a numerical increase, which is considered a worse outcome/decline; negative change/numerical decrease is considered a better outcome/improvement.
measure.population: The EFS consisted of all participants who signed the ICF for the second extension study. Number of participants is those with secondary hypertension and both baseline and LT Visit 19 observations for that test.

reported_events.time_frame: This study only collected the occurrence of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) occurring within the first 30 days after the participant had completed the first extension study. SAEs experienced after this 30 day period were reported to Novartis/Noden only if the investigator suspected a causal relationship to the study drug. Every SAE, within the above timeframe was to be reported to Novartis/Noden within 24 hours of learning of its occurrence.

group.title: Enalapril
group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. The arm/group in this second extension study refers to the actual treatment arm/group assigned at the end of the first extension study (Study CSPP100A2365E1: ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT01151410). During Study CSPP100A2365E1, participants were to receive one of the following doses of enalapril based on their weight: low weight (≥20 to <50 kg) participants - starting dose 2.5 mg with optional titration to 5 and then 10 mg; mid weight (≥50 to <80 kg) participants - starting dose 5 mg with optional titration to 10 and then 20 mg; high weight (≥80 to ≤150 kg) participants - starting dose 10 mg with optional titration to 20 and then 40 mg.

group.title: Aliskiren
group.description: No study treatment (aliskiren or enalapril) was administered in this off-therapy non-interventional second extension study. The arm/group in this second extension study refers to the actual treatment arm/group assigned at the end of the first extension study (Study CSPP100A2365E1: ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT01151410). During Study CSPP100A2365E1, participants were to receive one of the following doses of aliskiren based on their weight: low weight (≥20 to <50 kg) participants - starting dose 37.5 mg with optional titration to 75 and then 150 mg; mid weight (≥50 to <80 kg) participants - starting dose 75 mg with optional titration to 150 and then 300 mg; high weight (≥80 to ≤150 kg) participants - starting dose 150 mg with optional titration to 300 and then 600 mg.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Contract with new study sponsor "Noden Pharma".

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to small sample sizes in the secondary hypertension etiology subgroups, the corresponding p-values for treatment comparisons should be interpreted with caution.
